item.title: Javac errror duh!
item.dc:creator: @bgdwie bgdwie
item.description:
@bgdwie wrote:

yes, i do this so i can use many different jdk versions and so i can specify which one, what you are doing is setting yoru bin folder to a wild card so nomatter where your JDK is it will work, very handy if your writing malicious code and want it to compile on the otherguys computer

Read full topic

item.title: Javac errror duh!
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

bgdwie:

look for a copy of java jdk, just google “java jdk download” install it an then when u go to do what ever u do right click on the batch file and add the jdk directory befor e javac

Uhhhhhh sure?

Downlad JDK, it’ll ask you if you want to install JRE as well.

To set your environmental variables go to Control Panel, System, the “Advanced” tab, and then Environmental Variables.
Find the path to your “bin” folder for Java. Should be something like. C:\Program Files\Java\Jdk___\Bin
Add “;” and the path to your bin folder right after everything else. No spaces!

Read full topic
